column4: Anyone know how ubuntu sees the volume names of different drives that are plugged in?  For example I have a firewire hfsplus formatted harddrive and it knows the name of it, but I cant find any command line tools that tell me the same
it uses the gnome-volume-manager. and you might try "less /etc/fstab" for a start :-)
ok, but if I am not running gnome will the volume manager work in the command line?
try less /etc/fstab for a start
another option for things you plug in could be dmsg | tail
i know how fstab work, but when I am not in the gui and I mount a volume I cant see the name of it
after you plug them in
that still doesnt show me the volume name, it shows me sda or what device name it has
ah. well, i'im not sure what you're talking about then. sorry
so for example if I have a drive called "Bob's Backup Drive"  How do I find that info out?
yeah...sorry. i really don't know :-(
plugg that drive into macosx it mounts it as Bob's Backup Drive, and the same with ubuntu, but if I mount that drive manually I cant find that information
right, and i don't know where to find it. i'm sorry
if you've installed 6.06 and done your updates, you *have* 6.06.1
(i think)
no im interested in the livecd
ohhhh
6.06 has alot of problems on ppc machines, I want to know if anything was fixed in 6.06.1
aha.
you might try googling it.....
have
